entries.author: curtis_ovid_poe
entries.text: Ovid is a long-standing member of the Perl community. He blogs, wrote books, and did amazing work for the Perl testing toolchain (he's amongst things responsible for Test::Class::Moose). Outside the Perl sphere, he also maintains a second blog providing tips and pointers to expat workers.
entries.title: Curtis 'Ovid' Poe

chapters.header: GitTip allows you to give a regular weekly monetary gift to people in order to encourage them to do more of the awesome stuff they have been doing. The gifts can be as low as 1 cent a week. In this section every week you will see a different Perl developer we recommend you support. Oh, and the Perl Weekly itself also has a GitTip account.
chapters.title: GitTip profile of the week

entries.text: Thanks to Jeffrey Ryan Thalhammer, the very shiny dependency graph of Stratopan has been ported to MetaCPAN.
entries.title: Dependency Graphs Are Now On MetaCPAN

entries.author: neil_bowers
entries.text: Neil Bowers draws our attention to the fulgurant growth of the Perl community on Gittip. Spoiler warning: we're now up to 509 members.
entries.title: The Perl gittip community has 499 members

entries.text: The first release candidate of the next perl is out! Now is the time to  test your code against it, for the time is short -- we're talking one-week type of short, here -- before the final cut  is made, and 5.20.0 officially launches.
entries.title: Perl 5.20.0 RC1 is now available

entries.author: thomas_klausner
entries.text: YAPC::EU is coming fastest than you might realize. If you're thinking about  presenting there, domm reminds us, now is the time to submit your talk.
entries.title: Submit talks for YAPC::Europe 2014!

entries.text: Stevan Little provides a quick recap of the Perl mop project(s), and the high-level lines of what to expect for the near future.
entries.title: On prototyping in public...

entries.author: sawyer_x
entries.text: The last installment of the Dancer interview of Sawyer X by Nikos Vaggalis. REST, only about web services? CGI, does it really have to die? Sawyer reveals all.
entries.title: All about Dancer - interview of Sawyer X part 3 and last

entries.text: Stevan Little revisits his recap of the perl-mop project(s), this time in more details.
entries.title: On prototyping in public... the long version

entries.author: barbie
entries.text: Barbie summarizes what happened in the CPAN testing world in April.
entries.title: CPAN Testers Summary

entries.author: sinan_unur
entries.text: If this is one of the questions that keep you awake at night, Sinan Unur might have some answers for you.
entries.title: What good is in an iterator?

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Gabor Szabo showcases a nice primer on Dancer, via the making of a blog engine.
entries.title: Building a blog engine using Perl Dancer

entries.author: david_farrell
entries.text: A short little reminder by David Farrell that, no matter how beffudling a snippet of Perl can be, B::Deparse is always there to help shed a light on what's really going on.
entries.title: Debunk Perl's magic with B::Deparse

entries.text: First we write programs. Then we write programs to start programs. Then Johnny Morano shows us how to write programs to watch programs and, if required, call programs to start programs.
entries.title: Monitor running processes with Perl

entries.text: If Vim is your editor of choice, you have to see this new utility  Ovid brilliantly stole and adapted for our Perlish needs.
entries.title: Automatic variable highlighting in vim

entries.author: dana_jacobsen
entries.text: Dana Jacobson has been working on the Math::Prime::Util module recently introducing improvements as well as new utility functions.
entries.title: Math::Prime::Util, May update

entries.text: Lightning talks, everybody loves them. The San Francisco Perl Mongers here offer us 12 of those tasty, tasty morsels, touching Go (the language), Semantic versioning, JavaScript things, educational stuff, with some Perl interspersed here and there.
entries.title: San Francisco Perl Mongers 2014 Lightning Talks

entries.text: A 16:57 min long talk given by Tom Hukins at YAPC::EU 2013.
entries.title: Monitoring Your Code with Log4perl

header: The first Release Candidate (RC release) of the next perl 5 is on CPAN, and unless anything terrible comes up, 5.20 might very well hit the street as early as next week. This week, in the new and spiffy department, we have new dependency graphs on MetaCPAN, a report on the state of the ongoing perl-mop projects, and even a Vim plugin that might make this editor feel like a young thing again. Enjoy! ~ `/anick
subject: Perl 5.20.0 RC1 is out!
